Donald Trump will be given the keys to the Oval Office when when he is sworn in as the next US President. 
While many fear for the future of America - and indeed the world - following his inauguration, the could actually be some positives for Britain. 
What are the benefits to having the billionaire in the White House for Britain? 1. Brexit 
Barack Obama infamously said Britain would be at the “back of the queue” when it came to negotiating a trade deal after we leave the EU. 
The noises from Trump have been more positive, with Republican leaders saying we will be at the front of the line. 
The danger is we strike a deal which could allow US firms access to the NHS and flood the UK with cheap food imports. Donald J. Trump prior to being sworn in as the 45th president of the United States (Photo: Getty Images North America) 2. Republicans could help 
There is a chance that once in office Trump could prove to be more restrained and pragmatic than his campaign appearances suggested. 
But if that is not the case, then many will hope the Republicans on Capitol Hill will block his worst policies. 3. He might clean up Washington DC 
Trump has repeatedly vowed to “drain the swamp” and take on the Washington establishment. 
He could follow through his promises by restricting the power of lobbyists, instituting a limit on how long you can serve in Congress and cutting federal budgets. But don’t hold your breath. Donald J. Trump and wife Melania Trump (Photo: Getty Images North America) 4. Maternity leave 
All Trump’s campaign announcements should carry a health warning but he did promise six weeks of paid maternity leave for new mothers and a bigger tax credit to make child care more affordable. 
Unfortunately, it is just for women. New fathers will not get paternity leave and stay-at-home dads will not get help with childcare. Read More Donald Trump protest in Newcastle on Friday could see hundreds turn up 5. The stimulus might work 
The tax cuts, massive infrastructure expenditure and pressure on US firms to create jobs in the US could boost the economy. 
Predictions his election would cause a rush on Wall Street have been proved wrong. 
But his plans will add to the US debt mountain and in the long term could undermine the country’s economic stability. Read More
